GRAYSCALE
CSS
 

A Minimalist Dream of CSS

Getting Started

Grayscale CSS provides a minimalistic approach to styling by putting layout in the forefront, removing color, allowing for developers to rapidly prototype layouts. Everything is extendable, so just apply your theme later! All in, the package is only 2kb gzipped!
Ready to go, compiled and minified CSS.

Shades of Gray

Grayscale CSS revolves arounds shades of gray to help quickly block out your designs, as such it provides helper classes to get you a full range of shades from white to black.
.white
.lightest
.lighter
.light
.gray
.dark
.darker
.darkest
.black

Buttons

Button styles are automaticly applyed for inherited button types and you can add the .button class to links. Inaddition, you can mix the shades above for variety.

Extend

Add color

.primary {color: #FFF; background-color: blue;}

Add Flair

.rounded {border-radius: .5em;}

Forms

Tables

Simple, designed with tabular data in mind. supports .condensed, .striped

Grid

Grayscale CSS uses a precent-based fluid grid system with 6 column sizes, and a max width of 1140px. Add a column-% class to every column, where % can be 20, 25, 33, 50, 100. For example:

100%
20%
20%
20%
20%
20%
30%
30%
30%
25%
25%
25%
25%
50%
50%

Utility

Style Description
.well Adds .5em padding to tag
.wall Adds .5em padding-left and padding-right to tag
.wide sets tag width 100%
.tall sets tag height 100%
.right float tag right
.left float tag left
.center centers tag
.block applys display:block
.inline applys display:inline
.clear applys clear:both
